pain_point: Answering service has terrible billing and support, with lost calls due to setup errors and unexplained forwarding changes.
Answering service was responsive during sales but customer service declined significantly after becoming a client.
Answering service wastes money by answering solicitation calls and inflates bills with long messages; switched to self-service tool at a fraction of the cost.
System issue erased call script causing messages to be taken as if calling an answering machine; law firm lost intake calls and escalation to management took days.
Answering service reliably answers calls but consistently fails to collect required information accurately, and fixing it just increases per-call costs.
Answering service reps regularly make errors like failing to process simple orders visible on the website; locked into service because phone number can't be ported.
Constant mistakes collecting emails, names, and required details; poor customer service response times; looking for a replacement.
Service quality declined from highly personalized to rote and embarrassing; receptionists seem overworked; switched to competitor.
Confusing pricing with ad hoc extra charges instead of plan upgrade suggestions; feels like they gouge busy professionals who don't have time to monitor billing.
Overcharged after company name/pricing change; auto-charged credit card without consent; looking for more stable pricing.
Sales promised compatibility with Google Voice but calls went to wrong places; technology integration failed; switched to competitor Conversational.
Basic info collected inaccurately with no effort to look up the right file in the database; constant need to re-input information.
Inconsistent live answering quality; considering cancellation because the core function is so badly overlooked.
Long hold times before live answer causing callers to hang up; receptionists can't understand callers; wrong company name used.
Receptionist didn't seem to know what was going on and couldn't give impression of working at the office; considering just answering calls themselves.
Incorrect information given to customers and incomplete messages; quality doesn't match the price despite agents being polite.
Charged for hang-up calls from robocallers; spam filtering solution doesn't work effectively enough to prevent billing.
Patients complaining about rude agents after years of declining service quality; actively looking for another service.
Long hold times, training issues with call handling, and charges being run up; terminating after years of use.
Slow answer times (10+ rings) and agents have difficulty reading the script.
AI receptionist transfers calls to live agents without consent raising the bill; settings don't save; cancellation process is intentionally difficult.
Upsold to a plan costing $700/month more than needed; support was unreachable; company overcharged by over $3,000 over 5 months.
Sales was aggressive about scheduling consultation but couldn't answer questions or provide working demos when things got specific.
Continued charging credit card for five months after trial cancellation; F rating with BBB; dishonest practices.
Overpromised AI capabilities, couldn't deliver; found a competitor with better AI at less than half the price; charged for months of unused service during setup.
Receptionists deny work and claim to book appointments but never do; management support is subpar.
Incoming calls suddenly marked as spam after years of good service; repeated assurances to fix the problem with no resolution, costing the business money.
AI sounds like a live human but too many kinks; lost calls during trial; dishonest cancellation policy requiring 30 days notice even after risk-free trial promise.
Agents fail to follow call handling instructions and scripts; intentionally make mistakes to boost follow-up calls and charges.
After 5 years, service deteriorated with failed callbacks costing potentially hundreds of thousands in lost revenue; company only offers $10 credits for major errors.
Dropped calls and lost business over two years; switched to US-based agents and all issues resolved immediately.
Billing errors from day one, promised HubSpot/RingCentral integrations didn't work, uncoordinated support; not worth $2,800/month.
Year-long parade of incompetence; wasted ad budget, lost customers; real switching costs keep unhappy customers trapped.
Continued billing after cancellation; refused refund unless credit card dispute was withdrawn; VP asked them to remove negative review.
Rude chat agent who refused to answer simple questions and ended chat abruptly.
Good onboarding but implementation failed; had to triple-check all work; agents lacked critical thinking and made copy-paste errors; $600/month to review their work.
Agents couldn't follow simple processes like taking international phone numbers despite 7 emails; service cut without notice mid-weekend leaving business unreachable.
Missed their own scheduled sales call; took 10 minutes for their own receptionist to figure out how to reach someone internally.
Answering service cancelled client's account for mentioning AI on their website; perceived as stuck in the past.
Systematic overbilling through opaque 'after-call work' charges; calls lasting 2:20 billed as 5 minutes; hundreds or thousands in overcharges with no transparency.
Caller received a call from the number and heard heavy breathing when calling back; not a business owner experience.
Answering service promised 30 free calls under 30 seconds but charged for all; bill was $360 vs contracted $275 despite using fewer minutes than allotted.
Receptionist was rude and unprofessional to a caller, resulting in a 1-star review for the law firm; possible racial bias; company refused to remove agent from rotation.
Charged by the minute while agents ask callers to spell everything 3-4 times to inflate call time; information not taken from script; told clients they weren't clients.
Fraudulent credit card charges from company the reviewer doesn't have an account with; not a business answering service experience.
Cosmetic surgery clinic's agents were unprofessional and couldn't handle sensitive medical calls; not bilingual as promised; recordings prove poor quality.
Charged for overages on minutes within the plan; service turned off randomly; unreliable; different reps give different answers every call.
Outsourced agents lacked training; used client minutes for testing; charged for HIPAA and IVR services never received; refused refund.
Unable to set up basic call forwarding after 4 hours on the phone; staff gives the runaround and hangs up.
Bottom-of-barrel receptionist quality who barely read scripts; billing doubled without notice; call duration hidden to obscure how long staff spends on calls.
Service switched off after credit card update; forced to buy new subscription at 3.5x the price to get business line back; left without phone for 35 days.
Script changes require days of back-and-forth; agents follow scripts robotically without common sense; decided to bring call handling in-house despite cost.
Six months of incomplete, misspelled messages; 70-80% of messages are incomplete or spam; $350/month for useless service; recommends hiring a real receptionist instead.
Scripting team couldn't understand financial business; agents were unprofessional and didn't follow scripts; 31 test calls all failed; $375 wasted.
After acquisition, call quality plummeted; agents give wrong information and get company name wrong; complaints go unresolved.
Complaint about answering service policy regarding specific therapy types and account cancellation due to content policies; not about call quality or AI receptionist.
AI receptionist for businesses starts with upsell options instead of helping; no real interaction, just constant sales pitch; can't resolve actual problems.
AI phone service broke promise of free account forever; changed access to voicemail requiring $60/month; business number now useless after a year of platform distribution.
Review about a scam subscription service linked to an IQ test app; completely unrelated to receptionist or answering services.
Law firm grew and Ruby started dropping calls of potential and existing clients; charged for dropped calls; forced to stay 26 more days costing $1,100 after cancellation.
Charges monthly without monitoring; enforces no-refund policy if you forget to cancel when not using the service.
Couldn't cancel subscription through dashboard; kept billing; had to cancel credit card; sent to collections agency after 6 months of declined charges.
Live chat agent was rude, unqualified, and repeatedly asked same questions; high price doesn't match basic service quality.
Review about an online gambling/scam site; completely unrelated to receptionist or answering services.
Ruby's quality nosedived post-2023 after CEO ouster, class action settlement, and system change; every call mishandled; receptionists can't follow basic scripts.
Charged by the minute while receptionists add unnecessary hold time; billing/customer service never available; billed after cancellation.
Understaffed with background noise issues; inaccurate messages; 10-day fix time for basic phone number issue.
Can't handle call distribution; weekly mistakes after system upgrade; takes days to correct errors; businesses lost revenue.
Former fan of Ruby for 3 years; customer service deteriorated, reps hang up on you; simple issues take hours to resolve.
Law firm receptionists failed to follow script, gave incorrect info to leads, lost prospective clients; no response to urgent emails; cost firm revenue.
Zero support response for over two weeks despite flagging as urgent; started looking for a new solution.
30-40% of calls dropped after switching from Google Voice; Clio integration doesn't work; receptionists clock inflated call times for basic info collection.
Grew too quickly with loss of quality, technical issues, and untrained personnel.
Calls going unanswered after 10 rings; clueless receptionist didn't know which company she was answering for; cancelled same day.
Constant price increases over 3 years; bot/spam calls counted against minutes; have to manually request blocking for each number.
Person answering was unintelligible; only received prank calls; waited 7+ minutes on hold to cancel; tried to charge additional fee to cancel.
Received hour-long recording of a phone ringing with no email response about why.
Account went live and charged without the customer knowing or being trained on how to use the service.
Charged for unrelated calls during free trial; no web panel for managing service; billed after cancellation with pay-to-cancel requirement.
Billed for spam calls and phone ringing time; $300/month for Google Calendar integration; wrong timezone scheduling; got addresses wrong; constant upselling.
Fraudulent credit card charges continuing after multiple cancellation requests; account still active months after cancellation.
Aggressive spam calls and emails after declining to sign up; competitors AnswerConnect and LexReception praised as cheaper and better.
Virtual assistant (not receptionist) faked timesheets and didn't complete tasks; general VA staffing complaint, not about answering services.
Virtual assistant service sells unqualified VAs and blames the customer; general VA staffing, not answering service.
Virtual assistant couldn't handle basic customer service or staff management; general VA service complaint, not about phone answering or receptionist.
VA service ghosted after deposit payment; refused refund; general virtual assistant staffing complaint, not answering service.
VA service upsold and underdelivered on skills; customer success manager pitched a competing service; general VA complaint, not answering service.
Virtual assistant service slow to respond and makes cancellation difficult; general VA service complaint, not about receptionist or phone answering.
